revision.comment: /* References */http→https for [[Internet Archive]] (see [[WP:VPR/Archive 127#RfC: Should we convert existing Google and Internet Archive links to HTTPS?|this RfC]])
revision.text:
The following [[United States Army]] units and commanders fought in the [[Battle of Williamsburg]] of the [[American Civil War]]. The [[Williamsburg Confederate order of battle|Confederate order of battle]] is shown separately. ==Abbreviations used== ===Military rank=== * '''MG''' = [[Major general (United States)|Major General]] * '''BG''' = [[Brigadier general (United States)|Brigadier General]] * '''Col''' = [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]] * '''Ltc''' = [[Lieutenant colonel (United States)|Lieutenant Colonel]] * '''Maj''' = [[Major (United States)|Major]] * '''Cpt''' = [[Captain (United States O-3)|Captain]] * '''Lt''' = [[1st Lieutenant#U.S. Army.2C U.S. Marine Corps and U.S. Air Force|Lieutenant]] * '''Bvt''' = [[Brevet (military)|Brevet]] ===Other=== * '''w''' = [[Wounded in action|wounded]] * '''mw''' = [[Mortal wound|mortally wounded]] * '''k''' = [[Killed in action|killed]]
==[[Army of the Potomac]]== MG [[George B. McClellan]]
Commanding in the field: BG [[Edwin V. Sumner]]
===[[III Corps (Union Army)|III Corps]]=== BG [[Samuel P. Heintzelman]] {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:25%;"| Division ! style="width:25%;"| Brigade ! Regiments and Others |- | rowspan=4 | Second Division
     BG [[Joseph Hooker]] | First Brigade
   BG [[Cuvier Grover]] | * [[2nd New Hampshire Volunteer Infantry|2nd New Hampshire]]: [[Gilman Marston]] * [[1st Regiment Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry|1st Massachusetts]]: Col [[Robert Cowdin]] * [[11th Regiment Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry|11th Massachusetts]]: Col [[William E. Blaisdell]] * 26th Pennsylvania: Col William F. Small ('''w'''), Maj Casper M. Berry |- | [[Excelsior Brigade|Second Brigade]]
   Col [[Nelson Taylor]] | * [[70th New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|70th New York]]: Col [[William Dwight]] ('''w&c'''), Maj Thomas Hold * [[72nd New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|72nd New York]]: Ltc Israel Moses * [[73rd New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|73rd New York]]: Col [[William R. Brewster]] * [[74th New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|74th New York]]: Ltc Charles H. Burtis |- | Third Brigade
   BG [[Francis E. Patterson]] | * [[5th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry|5th New Jersey]]: Col [[Samuel H. Starr]] * [[6th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry|6th New Jersey]]: Ltc John P. Van Leer ('''k'''), Maj [[George C. Burling]] * [[7th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry|7th New Jersey]]: Ltc [[Ezra A. Carman]] ('''w'''), Maj Francis Price, Jr. * [[8th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry|8th New Jersey]]: Col Adolphus J. Johnston ('''w'''), Maj Peter H. Ryerson ('''k''') |- | Artillery
   Maj [[Charles S. Wainwright]] | * Battery D, 1st New York Artillery: Cpt [[Thomas W. Osborn]] * 4th New York Battery: Cpt James E. Smith * 6th New York Battery: Cpt Walter M. Bramhal * Battery H, 1st United States Artillery: Cpt Charles H. Webber |- | rowspan=4 | Third Division
     BG [[Philip Kearny]] | First Brigade
   BG [[Charles Davis Jameson]] | * [[57th Pennsylvania Infantry|57th Pennsylvania]]: Col [[Charles Thomas Campbell|Charles T. Campbell]] * [[63rd Pennsylvania Infantry|63rd Pennsylvania]]: Col [[Alexander Hays]] * [[105th Pennsylvania Volunteer Infantry|105th Pennsylvania]]: Col Amor A. McKnight * 87th New York: Col Stephen A. Dodge |- | Second Brigade
   BG [[David B. Birney]] | * 38th New York: Col [[J. H. Hobart Ward]] * [[40th New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|40th New York]]: Col Edward J. Riley * [[3rd Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment|3rd Maine]]: Col Henry G. Staples * [[4th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment|4th Maine]]: Col Elijah Walker |- | Third Brigade
   BG [[Hiram George Berry|Hiram G. Berry]] | * [[2nd Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment|2nd Michigan]]: Col [[Orlando M. Poe]] * [[3rd Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment|3rd Michigan]]: Col [[Stephen G. Champlin]] * [[5th Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment|5th Michigan]]: Col [[Henry D. Terry]] * [[37th New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|37th New York]]: Col Samuel B. Hayman |- |Artillery
   Cpt James Thompson | * [[Battery B, 1st New Jersey Light Artillery]]: Cpt John E. Beam * [[Battery E, 1st Rhode Island Light Artillery]]: Cpt George E. Randolph * [[2nd U.S. Light Artillery, Battery G|Battery G, 2nd U.S. Artillery]]: Cpt James Thompson |} ===[[IV Corps (ACW)|IV Corps]]=== BG [[Erasmus D. Keyes]] {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:25%;"| Division ! style="width:25%;"| Brigade ! Regiments and Others |- | rowspan=4 | First Division
     BG [[Darius N. Couch]] | First Brigade
   BG [[Charles Devens]] | * [[7th Regiment Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry|7th Massachusetts]]: Col [[David Allen Russell|David A. Russel]] * [[10th Regiment Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry|10th Massachusetts]]: Col [[Henry Shaw Briggs|Henry S. Briggs]] * [[2nd Rhode Island Infantry|2nd Rhode Island]]: Col [[Frank Wheaton]] * [[36th New York Infantry|36th New York]] |- | Second Brigade
   BG [[Lawrence P. Graham]] | * [[23rd Pennsylvania Infantry|23rd Pennsylvania]]: Col [[Thomas H. Neill]] * 31st Pennsylvania: Col David H. Williams * [[61st Pennsylvania Infantry|61st Pennsylvania]]: Col Oliver H. Rippey * [[65th New York Volunteer Infantry|65th New York]]: Ltc [[Alexander Shaler]] * [[67th New York Infantry|67th New York]]: Ltc Nelson Cross |- | Third Brigade
   BG [[John J. Peck]] | * [[55th New York Volunteer Infantry|55th New York]]: Col [[RÃ©gis de Trobriand|P. Regis de Trobriand]] * [[62nd New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|62nd New York]]: Col [[John Lafayette Riker|John L. Riker]] * [[93rd Pennsylvania Infantry|93rd Pennsylvania]]: Col James M. McCarter * [[98th Pennsylvania Infantry|98th Pennsylvania]]: Col John F. Ballier * [[102nd Pennsylvania Infantry|102nd Pennsylvania]]: Col [[Thomas Algeo Rowley]] |- |Artillery
   Maj Robert M. West | * [[Battery C, 1st Pennsylvania Light Artillery]]: Cpt Jeremiah McCarthy * [[Battery D, 1st Pennsylvania Light Artillery]]: Cpt Edward H. Flood * Battery E, 1st Pennsylvania Light Artillery: Cpt Theodore Miller * Battery H, 1st Pennsylvania Light Artillery: Cpt James Brady |- | rowspan=4 | Second Division
     BG [[William Farrar Smith|William F. Smith]] | First Brigade
   BG [[Winfield Scott Hancock|Winfield S. Hancock]] | * [[5th Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry Regiment|5th Wisconsin]]: Col [[Amasa Cobb]] * [[6th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment|6th Maine]]: Col [[Hiram Burnham]] * [[43rd New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|43rd New York]]: Col Francis L. Vinton * [[49th Pennsylvania Infantry|49th Pennsylvania]]: Col William H. Irwin |- | [[Vermont Brigade|Second Brigade]]
   BG [[William T. H. Brooks]] | * [[2nd Vermont Infantry|2nd Vermont]]: Col Henry Whitting * [[3rd Vermont Infantry|3rd Vermont]]: Col Breed N. Hyde * [[4th Vermont Infantry|4th Vermont]]: Col [[Edwin H. Stoughton]] * [[5th Vermont Infantry|5th Vermont]]: Ltc [[Lewis A. Grant]] * [[6th Vermont Infantry|6th Vermont]]: Ltc Nathan Lord |- | Third Brigade
   BG [[John Davidson (general)|John Davidson]] | * [[7th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment|7th Maine]]: Col Edwin C. Mason * [[33rd New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment|33rd New York]]: Col Robert F. Taylor * [[49th New York Volunteer Infantry|49th New York]]: Col [[Daniel D. Bidwell]] * [[77th New York Volunteer Infantry|77th New York]]: Col [[James B. McKean]] |- | Artillery
   Cpt [[Romeyn B. Ayres]] | * 1st New York Battery: Lt [[Andrew Cowan (soldier)|Andrew Cowan]] * 3rd New York Battery: Cpt [[Thaddeus P. Mott]] * Battery E, 1st New York Light Artillery: Cpt Charles C. Wheeler * Battery F, 5th U.S. Artillery: Cpt Romeyn B. Ayres |- | rowspan=4 | Third Division
     BG [[Silas Casey]] | First Brigade
   BG [[Henry Morris Naglee]] | * [[52nd Pennsylvania Infantry|52nd Pennsylvania]]: Col John C. Dodge, Jr. * 104th Pennsylvania: Col William W.H. Davis * 56th New York: Col [[Charles H. Van Wyck]] * [[100th New York Volunteer Infantry|100th New York]]: Col James M. Brown * [[11th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment|11th Maine]]: Col [[John C. Caldwell]] |- | Second Brigade
   BG [[William H. Keim]] | * 96th New York: Ltc Charles O. Gray * [[85th Pennsylvania Infantry|85th Pennsylvania]]: Col [[Joshua B. Howell]] * 101st Pennsylvania: Col Joseph H. Wilson * 103rd Pennsylvania: Maj Audley W. Gazzon |- | Third Brigade
   BG [[Innis N. Palmer]] | * 81st New York: Ltc Jacob J. De Forest * 85th New York: Col Jonathan S. Belknap * 92nd New York: Ltc Hiram Anderson, Jr. * [[93rd New York Volunteer Infantry|93rd New York]]: Ltc Benjamin C. Butler * 98th New York: Col William Dutton |- | Artillery
   Col Guilford D. Bailey | * 7th New York Battery: Cpt Peter C. Regan * 8th New York Battery: Cpt Butler Fitch * Battery A, 1st New York Artillery: Cpt Thomas H. Bates * Battery H, 1st New York Artillery: Cpt Joseph Spratt |- | rowspan=1 | | Cavalry | * 5th U.S. Cavalry: Maj Joseph H. Whittlesey |} ===Cavalry Advanced Guard=== BG [[George Stoneman]] {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:35%;"| Brigade ! Regiments and Others |- | Cooke's Brigade
     BG {{nowrap|[[Philip St. George Cooke]]}} | * [[1st Cavalry Regiment (United States)|1st U.S. Cavalry]]: Ltc William N. Grier * [[6th Cavalry Regiment (United States)|6th U.S. Cavalry]]: Maj Lawrence Williams |- | First Brigade
   BG [[William H. Emory]] | * [[3rd Pennsylvania Cavalry]]: Col [[William W. Averell]] * [[8th Regiment Illinois Volunteer Cavalry|8th Illinois Cavalry]]: Col [[John F. Farnsworth]] * [[Independent Illinois Volunteer Cavalry Companies|McClellan Dragoons]]: Maj Charles W. Barker |- | Artillery
   Ltc [[William Hays (general)|William Hays]] | * Batteries B and L, 2nd U.S. Artillery: Cpt [[James M. Robertson]] * Battery M, 2nd U.S. Artillery: Cpt Henry M. Benson * Battery C, 3rd U.S. Artillery: Cpt [[Horatio Gates Gibson|Horation G. Gibson]] * Battery K, 3rd U.S. Artillery: Cpt [[John C. Tidball]] |}
==References== * Hastings, Earl C. and David S. Hastings. ''A Pitiless Rain: The Battle of Williamsburg, 1862.'' Shippensburg, Pennsylvania; White Mane Publishing Company, 1997. ISBN 1-57249-042-X * {{cite web|last1=Richard|first1=J.|title=The Armies at the Battle of Williamsburg, 5 May 1862|url=http://www.historyofwar.org/articles/armies_williamsburg.html|website=History of War|date=20 June 2007|accessdate=2 February 2016}} * Robert Underwood Johnson, Clarence Clough Buell, [https://archive.org/details/battlesleadersof02cent ''Battles and Leaders of the Civil War'', Volume 2 (Pdf)], New York: The Century Co., 1887. {{DEFAULTSORT:Williamsburg Union Order Of Battle}} [[Category:American Civil War orders of battle]]
